sourceMeaningMnemonic: When <radical>dawn</radical> reaches this <radical>village</radical> it increases in <kanji>quantity</kanji>. That's right. Every morning the <kanji>amount</kanji> of people or animals living here goes up by at least one.
meaningInfo: Picture dawn, the sun rising, the birds chirping, and the screams of a new born baby rise in the village. Or Maybe it's a new sheep! Or a new hat that someone just finished making.
readingMnemonic: Today's dawn has brought with it an increase in the <kanji>quantity</kanji> of <reading>row</reading> boats! Aww, aren't they cute? Look at all of the new row boats lined up together. They all have their own sets of oars too.
readingInfo: When every dawn brings a new amount of people, those new people are going to need that same amount of row boats.
